data.title: Libgdx requires OpenGL ES 2.0
data.body:
#### Version of LibGDX
``` java
appName = "my-gdx-game"
gdxVersion = '1.9.6'
roboVMVersion = '2.3.0'
box2DLightsVersion = '1.4'
ashleyVersion = '1.7.0'
aiVersion = '1.8.0'
```

#### platforms
- Android

#### Stacktrace
```java
java.lang.RuntimeException:Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.cutler.dragonmap/com.cutler.dragonmap.ui.main.MainActivity}: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Libgdx requires OpenGL ES 2.0
 android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2180)
 ......
 Caused by:
 com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException:Libgdx requires OpenGL ES 2.0
 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.createGLSurfaceView(AndroidGraphics.java:139)
 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.<init>(AndroidGraphics.java:119)
 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.<init>(AndroidGraphics.java:112)
 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidApplication.init(AndroidApplication.java:138)
 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidApplication.initializeForView(AndroidApplication.java:129)
 com.cutler.dragonmap.ui.main.MainActivity.initSkinGame(MainActivity.java:60)
 com.cutler.dragonmap.ui.main.MainActivity.onCreate(MainActivity.java:51)
 android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5104)
 android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1080)
 android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2144)
```

#### Issue details
The Activity extends of the AndroidApplication.java is highly coupled, and does it consider the interface to be implemented?

For example, my App can't be initialized (lower than OpenGL ES 2.0) on some phone, will crash, and to avoid crash, I'll use the following code:

```java
try{
         AndroidApplicationConfiguration config = new AndroidApplicationConfiguration();
        View view = initializeForView(skinGame, config);
}catch(Exception e){
      //...........
}
```
But there are still problems with android application's onResume method:
``` java
Caused by:
 java.lang.NullPointerException:
 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidApplication.onResume(AndroidApplication.java:299)
 android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnResume(Instrumentation.java:1184)
 android.app.Activity.performResume(Activity.java:5082)
 android.app.ActivityThread.performResumeActivity(ActivityThread.java:2565)
 android.app.ActivityThread.handleResumeActivity(ActivityThread.java:2603)
 android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2089)
 android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:130)
 android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1195)
 android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
 com.android.qihooSandbox.QihooBridge.invokeOriginalMethodNative(Native Method)
 com.android.qihooSandbox.QihooBridge.handleHookedMethod(QihooBridge.java:766)
 android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Native Method)
 android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137)
 android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4745)
 java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
```

data.title: Fix WindowedMean bug
data.body:
`WindowedMean.getOldest()` usually returns the second oldest value.

Also added a method for getting the final part of the stream in order, to enable easy serialization/copying.

data.title: Mesh needs to check index array, resolves #4697
data.body: This is a pull request to throw an exception if a Mesh tries to render with indices outside of the index array. Created because of #4697

data.title: Added usefull method overloading of espilonEquals for Vector classes
data.body: You are no longer obligated to provide a epsilon, the default parameter is now MathUtils.FLOAT_ROUNDING_ERROR making it easier to use and more readable

data.title: Freetype font rendering bug after 1.7.1 version
Updated moe version to last released
data.body: Fixed moe assets resource handling

data.title: Controllers stops working after screen mode changes
data.body:
Hello.
i am trying to add gamepad support to my libgdx game and i am hacing a issue when the display mode changes (window to  fullscreen or fullscreen to window)

the gamepad stops working after settings are updated

Controller devices: Xbox 360 Wired Controller for Windows, Eurocase EUGA-58,
Platform: Desktop (Windows 10 Pro 64 bits)
libGDX version: 1.9.5, 1.9.6 and 1.9.7-SNAPSHOT 26/4/2017 (all versions have the same problem)
![eyes of light 26_4_2017 20_05_43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/28076720/25464837/cc253c44-2abb-11e7-9f09-399de6990a19.png)

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from libgdx/master
data.body: update from origin

data.title: Add getFilter and fix GWT getBlending
data.body:
Pixmap needs a `getFilter()` method so it can be copied or serialized.

**Also:** GWT's Pixmap had initial state of null for `getBlending()`. It should have an initial state so the getter method will have the same results across platforms. That's why I also added a `filter` parameter, even though it goes unused.

data.title: There are problems plotting the texture picture in android
Added touch input delta to RemoteInput
data.body:
Added two new arrays in RemoteInput, deltaX and deltaY. They record the difference in X and Y position between input readings.

Also updated the existing getDeltaX and getDeltaY methods, to return the corresponding new values.

data.title: fix libgdx/libgdx#4706
Invalid Provisioning Profile. Application Loader
data.body:
I need to create this ticket I have no more idea. It took me time to get moe with libgdx working and now everything works fine I can test on my ipad and simulator. But I can't distribute the IPA to app store I tried everything.

So I use the command ./gradlew moeIpaBuild Build is Successfull
I upload it with the application loader and then error: ERROR ITMS-90161: "Invalid Provisioning Profile. The provisioning profile included in the bundle net.rainware.cat [Payload/fatflatcat.app] is invalid. [Missing code-signing certificate]. A Distribution Provisioning profile should be used when submitting apps to the App Store. For more information, visit the iOS Developer Portal."

What I already did / tried. Providing signing information in build.gradle I set my distribution profile my team everything. In the logs it always seems like he is using development. Also I had to uncheck automatic signing since this also not worked. Then I tried setting up everything manually in xcode to distribution no luck. I generated new distribution profile and certificate no luck it is always the same error 90161

The build provides a log at /var/folders/z3/xsf5js3d27b1q9h45zy_2d7c0000gn/T/ios-moe_2017-04-24_13-55-01.197.xcdistributionlogs there i can only see development sigining never distribution which is set in xcode.

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [X] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Fixed a bunch of typos in various files
data.body: What the title says

data.title: Update GWT controller extension and add POV support
data.body:
Due to changes in the way browsers handle controllers since the extension was written, the GWT controllers extension wasn't working anymore. Fortunately, all major browsers now pretty much conforms to the W3C working draft so the extension shouldn't break too much in the future.

This updates the extension to use the currently supported controller api. I've also added proper POV support for gamepads reporting a "standard" mapping. In my tests, only XInput gamepads reported as "standard" and everyting else had different ways of reporting their pov, which also differed between browsers.

This was tested as working on Chrome, Firefox and Opera.

data.title: Specify units of angle for camera rotation on `Camera`
data.body: It was not clear at a glance whether this expected radians or degrees (it's degrees).

data.title: ResolutionFileResolver provides no access to decorated FileHandleResolver
data.body:
#### Issue details
`FileHandleResolver baseResolver` field of `ResolutionFileResolver` is protected, which makes it harder to access. This is inconsistent with `PrefixFileHandleResolver`, which exposes all internal settings. Both `descriptors` and `baseResolver` fields could use public getters.

#### Version of LibGDX
1.9.6, most likely affects previous versions.

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS (robovm)
- [x] iOS (MOE)
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: Support for Blender 2017
data.body:
Fbx-conv has never been updated, and does not support blender 2017.

Loading a normal .obj, made in blender, the following error occurs.

Invalid part specified ( offset=0, count=0, max=39804 )


Is there another Fbx-conv compatible with Blender 2017?

data.title: Garbage being created in BaseShader
data.body:
#### Issue details
The BaseShader is creating garbage int[] arrays each frame in BaseShader.getAttributeLocations  when using meshes with a different number of vertex attributes. https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/shaders/BaseShader.java#L215 

Having a different number of vertex attributes oftens means a different shader would be used for the renderanble, so IntArray add/shrink would never create new internal int[] arrays and everything would be fine. However, when rendering shadows, the same shader (DepthShader) is handling all the non-skinned meshes (good) causing the tempArray to constantly recreate its underlying int[] array (bad).

After discussing with Xoppa, the best solution is to add a 'size' argument to the bind/unbind methods in  Mesh, VertexData, and all implementing classes in the backends.

#### Reproduction steps/code
This can be reproduced by creating ModelInstances with two different vertex attributes and rendering shadows (or any shader that renders different vertex attributes).

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.6

#### Please select the affected platforms
All Platforms.

data.title: Update CONTRIBUTORS
data.body: I keep forgetting to do this every time I submit a PR

data.title: NullPointerException in Bezier#approxLength
data.body:
#### Issue details
Setting the points of a Bezier path with `Bezier#set(Array<T> points, int offset, int length)` causes a subsequent call to `Bezier#approxLength(int samples)` to throw a NullPointerException.

#### Reproduction steps/code
In the aforementioned method `Bezier#set(Array<T> points, int offset, int length)` the temp variables `tmp2` and `tmp3` are not set as they should (see also the other method `Bezier#set(T[] points, int offset, int length)`). So calling `Bezier#approxLength(int samples)` throws a NPE because it uses `tmp2` and `tmp3`.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
_Please provide the version(s) affected._

#### Stacktrace
no need

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ X ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

- Does it support playing pose animation?

Thanks!

data.title: Can set null region on TextureRegionDrawable
data.body:
The reason for this is so the TextureRegionDrawable itself, or any WidgetGroup that references it, can be used in a Pool. If you have a widget that is poolable and references any TextureRegion (indirectly through a TextureRegionDrawable), there needs to be a way to null out the TextureRegion reference for returning it to the pool. 

This moves the NPE from `setRegion` to `draw`, but presumably `draw` won't be called on it if it's been sent to a pool.

My use case is that I have a large panel of custom image buttons, and the number of buttons and the images vary each time the panel is brought up, so I wanted to pool the buttons to make it a bit more snappy.

data.title: Added setX and setY methods with alignment argument
data.body: Found myself looking for these methods so decided to create them.

data.title: NetJavaImpl.HttpClientResponse swallowing exceptions thrown by HttpURLConnection
data.body:
#### Issue details
`HttpClientResponse` silently ignores all exceptions thrown by the `Connection` input stream, including exception thrown if the connection was already closed. After the response content is extracted with `getResult` (or one of its alternatives), the input stream is closed and subsequent calls to `getResult` will return an empty byte array, empty stream or empty string, without warning the user.

Possible solutions:
- Cache response result as byte array. Wrap with string or input stream on demand. Make `HttpClientResponse` thread-safe and reusable.
- Rethrow silently ignored exceptions. I think making `HttpResponse` a single-use object is somewhat OK, as long as the user is able to track the source of the issue.
- At the very least - add some warning logs for ignored exceptions.

#### Reproduction
A Kotlin example reproducing the issue - should be trivial to convert to Java:
```Kotlin
fun main(args: Array<String>) {
  val net = NetJavaImpl()
  val request = HttpRequest("GET")
  request.url = "http://google.com"
  net.sendHttpRequest(request, object : HttpResponseListener {
    override fun cancelled() = Unit
    override fun failed(t: Throwable?) {
      t?.printStackTrace()
    }
    override fun handleHttpResponse(httpResponse: HttpResponse) {
      println("Content: ${httpResponse.resultAsString}")
      println("Content: ${httpResponse.resultAsString}")
    }
  })
  Thread.sleep(1000L)
}
```

`"Content: "` is printed by the second `println` execution. No exceptions are thrown.

#### Version of LibGDX
1.9.6, although I'm pretty sure the issue exists in earlier versions.

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS (robovm)
- [x] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS
